snippet: Because uranium converted into reactor fuel is more difficult to enrich to a weapon-grade purity, the move could limit the expansion of Iran’s stockpile.
abstract: Iran says it is converting some of its enriched uranium into reactor fuel, potentially limiting expansion of stockpiles West fears could be used for weapons; announcement comes as Iran prepares for two sets of negotiations with international community on its disputed nuclear program.
lead_paragraph: Because uranium converted into reactor fuel is more difficult to enrich to a weapon-grade purity, the move could limit the expansion of Iran’s stockpile.

headline.seo: Iran Converts Enriched Uranium to Reactor Fuel, Reports Say
headline.main: Iran Is Said to Convert Enriched Uranium to Reactor Fuel
headline.print_headline: Iran Is Said to Convert Enriched Uranium to Reactor Fuel
